data.title: Why didn't Super Buu revert back to Evil Buu?

data.text:
Initially, we're introduced to Fat Buu. In a fit of rage, he separates himself into two: the good Mr. Buu and the evil grey Buu. This is something that we've seen before with the Nameless Namekian who split into Kami and Piccolo Daimao so no problem here.

What I find weird however is that despite coming from the not so remarkably intelligent Fat Buu, the grey Evil Buu is not only capable of proper speech, but he's also pretty intelligent. Why is that? Then the Evil Buu absorbs the Good Buu and triggers a transformation that changes him into Super Buu, becoming massively stronger than the original Fat Buu but also less intelligent than the grey Evil Buu.

Super Buu's transformation tree is pretty straightforward and easy to understand. Whenever he absorbs someone his appearance changes to match that person and he also gains their strength and abilities.

Super Buu goes through Buutenks, Buuccolo and finally his Buuhan form. However, after Goku and Vegeta manage to infiltrate his body and rescue the others, Super Buu says that if they sever Good Buu's connection he'll cease to exist, as in he'll change to something different.

Logically, severing Good Buu's connection would mean that he revers back to the grey Evil Buu that absorbed the former in the first place. However, that was not the case...

Super Buu first revers to Buff Buu (who is stronger than him) but then quickly changes to Kid Buu.

Now Buff Buu and Kid Buu came out of nowhere and make no sense.

We later find out that Buff Buu is the result of Kid Buu absorbing the South Kaioshin. So that means that Buff Buu would become his permanent new form. Why is it that he changes back into Kid Buu? He should've stayed Buff.

Then Kid Buu himself makes no sense either since he should've reverted back into the grey Evil Buu in the first place.

i can imagin toriyama gettin confused on who is the strongest buu himself.

Kid Buu does indeed seem like a last minute idea.

There are two problems with severing Good Buu's connection to Super Buu:

1) He reverted into Buff Buu instead of the grey one, totally random form that was even stronger than Super Buu ironically.

2) He then further reverted into Kid Buu (which should be impossible since the absorptions change Buu permanently unless temporary buffs like Gotenks), who is yet another random form instead of the grey one.

Evil Boo was just Boo's anger and darkness. It still had the Kaio influence, because it was still a part of Boo and

I have no fucking idea.

No you are absolutely correct. Evil Buu was a personification of Fat Buu's rage as stated by the narrator. That's why he had the Dai Kaioshin outfit like him. He was simply the manifestation of the anger he couldn't contain anymore. Said anger took most of his power which is why it easily beat up the good half and when it merged them again, it resulted in the "evil" Fat Buu counterpart we know as Super Buu.

Kid Buu is simply the real, unaltered form of Buu. He's the essence of them all.

Are Evil and Super Buu actually decidedly more intelligent than Fat Buu? They're less childish than Fat Buu, including in their speech patterns, but is there clear evidence that they're smarter? I don't even remember Evil Buu uttering a single word because his appearance was so brief, so I can't comment on his intelligence versus Super Buu.

I think semi-reasonable explanations for the rest of this stuff have been offered up in the thread, though I'm pretty sure the real answer is summarized as

Super Boo is just as stupid as Fat Boo, he's just mean and more concerned about fighting. He falls for the same kind of juvenile tricks that would work on Fat Boo

Muscular Boo:

Because the last fight was mean for Goku and Vegeta working together but any version of Boo with someone absorbed was too strong. Toriyama wrote himself into a corner by saying the South Kai was absorbed so Boo was given a limit of how many beings he can be fused with at any given time, Muscular Boo is the remains of the Kaioshin power that where still present somewhere in Boo.

The plot in the last part of the Boo arc repeatedly twists itself so it can end on the Genkidama.

Kid Boo:

The kid form is the real Boo, the original pure evil monster, Evil Boo is that evil part taking control of a little more than half of the power and body from the Boo that was already fused with a Kaioshin.

Fat buu is simply Kid buu absorbing Dai Kaioshin.

Super Buu is the same components of Fat Boo, he did not absorb anybody in addition to the current components. He is simply a manifestation of Buu's dominant demeanor shifting from being that of a kind-hearted entity to being evil. That is why many people refer to "Super Buu" as "Evil Buu", because it is Buu who's make up is the same, but which has become evil.(And this apparently makes him stronger somehow)

The grey "Evil buu" that we know is simply a tangible means for Toriyama to show Buu becoming evil. He isn't really a result of any particular mix like the others are:

Kid buu: Original

Fat Buu: Kid buu+Dai Kaioshin(Good)

Super Buu: Kid buu+Dai Kaioshin(Evil)

The Grey Boo exists solely for that scene, and does not need to represent anything further than that.

Or at least that is how I interpet it with my head canon. The Buu arc is a bunch of convoluted trash.
